result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert J Howard was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 36 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine, Surcharge and Fees to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Cash Bail to be refunded to poster.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Muskego Police Department.

Transcript Fee:  $8.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to District Attorney's Office.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Within 30 days be involved in a 12 step program and within 60 days have a sponsor/mentor.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Count #3 was Dismissed.  Waukesha County Case #13CM2266 was Dismissed and Read into Waukesha County Case #14CF44.

superTimeConds.notes: Each year of extended supervision with the Last 20 hours to be completed with the First 10 months.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel Meeting with the First 6 months of release onto Extended Supervision.

Defendant Robert J Howard in court, in custody, with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Court discusses how it needs to take the defendant into custody immeditaly once convicted.  Atty. Holzman was unaware and requests a later further proceedings date.  Court will set for trial. filed by Atty. Holzman
Hearing on March 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Howard in court with attorney Michael Holzman.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Angela Mesich from the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn and testified. State and counsel stipulate that Mr. Howard has 5 prior convictions of OWI. Cross examination by defense. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State moves for bind over and probable cause. Defense objects to bind over and provides closing statements.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
